Taxon name.Name: Trichoderma reesei
Taxon name.Synonymy: Current name: Trichoderma reesei E.G. Simmons 1977 MB#324906

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
Applications: production of: cellulase (Biotechnol. Lett. 5: 25-28, 1983; Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 45: 153-160, 1983), alpha galactosidase (ibid. 59: 1347-1353, 1993; FEMS Microbiol. Lett. 115: 259-264, 1994), alpha arabinofuranosidase (ibid), cellulase and xylanase (Biotechnol. Lett. 6: 119-122, 1984; Appl. Microbiol. Biotechnol. 40, 224-229, 1993), extracellular lactase (Biotechn. Lett., 6: 593-596, 1984), endoglucanases (Enzyme Microb. Technol. 9: 25-32, 1987), cellulase poor xylanases (Appl. Microbiol. Biotechnol. 38: 315-322, 1992), acetyl esterases (Ibid., 33: 506-510, 1990; Biotechnol. Appl. Biochem. 13: 1-11, 1991), alkaline xylanase (Arch. Microbiol. 159: 417-422, 1993), ß-mannanases (J. Biotechnol. 29: 229-242, 1993), alpha glucoronidase (Enzyme Microb. Technol. 16: 813-819, 1994) and ß-xylanases I and II, endoglucanases I and II, and cellobiohydrolases I and II (Process Biochem. 31: 253-263, 1996); transformation host (Gene (Amst.) 85: 343-351, 1989; Bio-Technology (N.Y.) 11: 591-595, 1993); expression of Phlebia radiata laccase gene (ibid., 9, 987-990, 1991); ethanol- and polyene resistant (J. Biotechnol. 29: 97-108, 1993)
